text: The Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela () is a cathedral in Galicia in Spain. It is in the World Heritage Site of Santiago de Compostela. People believe that Saint James the Great, one of the apostles of Jesus, is buried there. The building is a Romanesque structure with later Gothic and Baroque additions. == References == ==Other websites== * * Reconstruction of the swinging motion of the Botafumeiro * Photographs of the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela, Galicia, Spain * Pictures of Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela * HyperSculpture - PÃ³rtico de la Gloria *The Art of medieval Spain, A.D. 500-1200, an exhibition catalog from The Metropolitan Museum of Art Libraries (fully available online as PDF), which contains material on Santiago de Compostela Cathedral (p. 175-183) * Video clip in Youtube Category:12 Treasures of Spain Category:Santiago de Compostela Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Spain Category:13th-century buildings and structures Category:1210s establishments in Europe
title: Santiago de Compostela Cathedral
